clusters.title: Tired all the time? There may be a simple reason for that
clusters.neutral_headline: Tired all the time? There may be a simple reason for that

items.title: Tired all the time? There may be a simple reason for that
items.standfirst: Levels of fatigue among women in Britain are soaring, and this isn’t the kind that can be cured by a nap. What lies behind the exhaustion epidemic?Look around you and it isn’t hard to find an exhausted woman. There she is, standing behind you in the queue at the post office or delivering your Amazon package. Here she is at the school gates, puffing after running from the car, coffee in hand, apologising for forgetting to pack a PE kit. Or trying to stop a yawn escaping during a long work meeting. Or eyes closed on a noisy commuter train, about to miss her stop.Maybe this seems normal to you because, honestly, in today’s fast-paced culture, who isn’t exhausted? But take a closer look and you’ll see that this level of fatigue is often much more than something a simple nap could remedy. You’ll find these bone-tired women asking friends in WhatsApp groups why their hair is falling out, or complaining to their beautician that their nails are always breaking, or manically Googling symptoms, trying to work out why their brains are so foggy or why, despite having youth on their side, they sometimes forget how to form a sentence. Friends ask each other online whether everyone else is so overwhelmed with anxiety that they can’t sleep. Perhaps they’re taking antidepressants and wondering why their racing thoughts are not relenting. They may have asked their GP why day-to-day life leaves them feeling so drained and been told it’s “inevitable” with small children, or asked if they are getting enough exercise. Continue reading...
items.content: Levels of fatigue among women in Britain are soaring, and this isn’t the kind that can be cured by a nap. What lies behind the exhaustion epidemic?Look around you and it isn’t hard to find an exhausted woman. There she is, standing behind you in the queue at the post office or delivering your Amazon package. Here she is at the school gates, puffing after running from the car, coffee in hand, apologising for forgetting to pack a PE kit. Or trying to stop a yawn escaping during a long work meeting. Or eyes closed on a noisy commuter train, about to miss her stop.Maybe this seems normal to you because, honestly, in today’s fast-paced culture, who isn’t exhausted? But take a closer look and you’ll see that this level of fatigue is often much more than something a simple nap could remedy. You’ll find these bone-tired women asking friends in WhatsApp groups why their hair is falling out, or complaining to their beautician that their nails are always breaking, or manically Googling symptoms, trying to work out why their brains are so foggy or why, despite having youth on their side, they sometimes forget how to form a sentence. Friends ask each other online whether everyone else is so overwhelmed with anxiety that they can’t sleep. Perhaps they’re taking antidepressants and wondering why their racing thoughts are not relenting. They may have asked their GP why day-to-day life leaves them feeling so drained and been told it’s “inevitable” with small children, or asked if they are getting enough exercise. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Fatigue levels among women in Britain are increasing.
The fatigue is not always resolved by rest.
Many women are experiencing persistent exhaustion.
Women are seeking answers for their fatigue.
The causes of this fatigue are varied and complex.

clusters.title: How scientists are shining light on the biology behind seasonal affective disorder
clusters.neutral_headline: Scientists Study Biology Behind Seasonal Affective Disorder

items.title: How scientists are shining light on the biology behind seasonal affective disorder
items.standfirst: Researchers tracking large cohorts are discovering the effects of sleep, light and therapy on people impacted by winter’s arrivalFor some, the darkening days of autumn bring more than the annual ritual of reviving woolly jumpers and turning on the central heating. As the evenings close in and the mornings grow murky, energy ebbs and a heavy sadness settles in.Although seasonal affective disorder (Sad) was only formally recognised by psychiatrists in the 1980s, the link between the seasons, mood and vitality has long been observed. Continue reading...
items.content: Researchers tracking large cohorts are discovering the effects of sleep, light and therapy on people impacted by winter’s arrivalFor some, the darkening days of autumn bring more than the annual ritual of reviving woolly jumpers and turning on the central heating. As the evenings close in and the mornings grow murky, energy ebbs and a heavy sadness settles in.Although seasonal affective disorder (Sad) was only formally recognised by psychiatrists in the 1980s, the link between the seasons, mood and vitality has long been observed. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Researchers are tracking large groups to discover effects of light, sleep, and therapy.
Seasonal affective disorder (SAD) was formally recognized by psychiatrists in the 1980s.
The link between seasons, mood, and vitality has been observed for a long time.
Darkening days of autumn can bring energy loss and a heavy sadness.
Some people experience more than just reviving woolly jumpers and turning on heat.

clusters.title: Weight loss jab warning: fraudsters’ fake products ‘could cause real harm’
clusters.neutral_headline: Weight Loss Jab Warning: Fraudulent Products Could Cause Harm

items.title: Weight loss jab warning: fraudsters’ fake products ‘could cause real harm’
items.standfirst: As texts and social media offer cheap offers, buying from unverified sellers can cause serious health problemsYou have heard and read so much about people using weight loss injections to get slim, you feel it is time to give it a go in the run-up to the festive season. The problem is cost.But it seems there are other options rather than getting a prescription from a doctor and going to the pharmacy. A text message arrives giving a link to a site with much cheaper medication – and with no need to go through official channels. And you saw a similar ad on social media the other day, so you decide to go for it. Continue reading...

Texts and social media offer cheaper medication options than prescriptions.
The article discusses the potential risks of purchasing weight loss products online.
The author is considering weight loss injections before the festive season.
The cost of weight loss injections is a concern for many people.

items.content: Up to 5,000 people in Scotland will take the injections as part of a multi-million pound study being led by Glasgow University.

The injections are part of a multi-million pound study.
The study is being led by Glasgow University.
The trial aims to assess the effectiveness of the injections.
Participants will be selected from the poorest Scots.

clusters.title: Even when unthinkable things were happening to me, my first instinct was to work. Am I addicted?
clusters.neutral_headline: Even when unthinkable things were happening to me, my first instinct was to work. Am I addicted?

items.title: Even when unthinkable things were happening to me, my first instinct was to work. Am I addicted?
items.standfirst: It was only years later, when I heard the word workaholic being used seriously for the first time, that I wondered whether I had a problemHave you ever heard a word that jolts you to attention? That word, for me, was “workaholism” – and when I heard it through my headphones earlier this year, listening to an audiobook on the tube, I felt a pang of something between recognition and panic. It transported me back to the worst time in my life.In May 2016, when I was nearly five months pregnant, I travelled to rural Norway to make a short documentary for the Guardian. The Norwegian government was making asylum seekers – from mostly Muslim countries – take cultural education classes about women’s rights. I’d been invited to a class in Moi, a town by a lake framed with pine trees, 100km south of Stavanger. Continue reading...

I’d been invited to a class in Moi, a town by a lake framed with pine trees, 100km south of Stavanger. Continue reading...

The author traveled to Norway to make a documentary about asylum seekers.
The documentary was about asylum seekers taking cultural education classes.

clusters.title: US food banks rush to stock supplies amid the Snap lapse: ‘We’re going to garner all the resources we can’
clusters.neutral_headline: US food banks rush to stock supplies amid the Snap lapse: ‘We’re going to garner all the resources we can’

items.title: US food banks rush to stock supplies amid the Snap lapse: ‘We’re going to garner all the resources we can’
items.standfirst: Food insecurity for millions of Americans is set to spike, with Trump officials saying Snap benefits will cease as the government shutdown enters its second monthWaves of hungry Angelenos gathered outside the Community Space food bank’s storefront on a recent afternoon, grabbing dry goods like pastries, bagels, lentils and pasta along with refrigerated salads and frozen bags of brisket.The crowd ebbs and flows all day, said founder Gaines Newborn, but as news spread last week that the federal Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap) would cease on Saturday, he braced for the need to dramatically increase. Continue reading...
items.content: Food insecurity for millions of Americans is set to spike, with Trump officials saying Snap benefits will cease as the government shutdown enters its second monthWaves of hungry Angelenos gathered outside the Community Space food bank’s storefront on a recent afternoon, grabbing dry goods like pastries, bagels, lentils and pasta along with refrigerated salads and frozen bags of brisket.The crowd ebbs and flows all day, said founder Gaines Newborn, but as news spread last week that the federal Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap) would cease on Saturday, he braced for the need to dramatically increase. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Food insecurity for millions of Americans is set to increase.
Snap benefits will cease as the government shutdown continues.
Food banks are preparing for a surge in demand.
The Community Space food bank is experiencing increased demand.
The food bank is stocking dry goods, salads, and frozen items.

clusters.title: How do Apple’s AirPods Pro 3 compare against hearing aids? I put them to the test
clusters.neutral_headline: How do Apple’s AirPods Pro 3 compare against hearing aids? I put them to the test

items.title: How do Apple’s AirPods Pro 3 compare against hearing aids? I put them to the test
items.standfirst: Can these earphones, with less cost and stigma than real aids, be a gateway for millions with untreated hearing loss?Sign up for the Filter US newsletter, your weekly guide to buying fewer, better thingsI didn’t think much about it when I asked my partner to repeat herself. But then I did it again. And again. And one day, my audiologist delivered the verdict: after years in war zones standing too close to things that went boom, I had moderate high-frequency hearing loss. I needed hearing aids. The option she showed me cost $7,000.The sticker shock hit harder than the diagnosis. In the US, insurance typically won’t cover hearing aids, which meant I was on the hook for the full cost, out of pocket. I found a compromise at Costco: the Jabra Enhance Pro 20s for $1,600. I spent the next month acclimating to their digital processing until it finally sounded normal. Continue reading...
items.content: Can these earphones, with less cost and stigma than real aids, be a gateway for millions with untreated hearing loss?Sign up for the Filter US newsletter, your weekly guide to buying fewer, better thingsI didn’t think much about it when I asked my partner to repeat herself. But then I did it again. And again. And one day, my audiologist delivered the verdict: after years in war zones standing too close to things that went boom, I had moderate high-frequency hearing loss. I needed hearing aids. The option she showed me cost $7,000.The sticker shock hit harder than the diagnosis. In the US, insurance typically won’t cover hearing aids, which meant I was on the hook for the full cost, out of pocket. I found a compromise at Costco: the Jabra Enhance Pro 20s for $1,600. I spent the next month acclimating to their digital processing until it finally sounded normal. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The author tested Apple's AirPods Pro 3 against hearing aids.
The author has moderate high-frequency hearing loss.
Hearing aids can cost up to $7,000 in the US without insurance.
The author found a compromise with Jabra Enhance Pro 20s for $1,600.
The author spent a month acclimating to the digital processing of the aids.

clusters.title: CDC employees on chaos of being fired, rehired and fired again: ‘stuck in limbo’
clusters.neutral_headline: CDC employees on chaos of being fired, rehired and fired again: ‘stuck in limbo’

items.title: CDC employees on chaos of being fired, rehired and fired again: ‘stuck in limbo’
items.standfirst: Americans’ health in jeopardy as agency plunged into tumult and inefficiency even after court ruled firings illegalAs layoff notices swept through the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on 10 October, Aryn Melton Backus thought she would be safe this time.Then she received the email: she was part of a major reduction in force (RIF) during the US government shutdown. It wasn’t the first time she’d been fired from the CDC by email, nor the second. Continue reading...
items.content: Americans’ health in jeopardy as agency plunged into tumult and inefficiency even after court ruled firings illegalAs layoff notices swept through the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on 10 October, Aryn Melton Backus thought she would be safe this time.Then she received the email: she was part of a major reduction in force (RIF) during the US government shutdown. It wasn’t the first time she’d been fired from the CDC by email, nor the second. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Layoff notices swept through the CDC on October 10.
Aryn Melton Backus was fired from the CDC by email.
The firings were part of a major reduction in force during the shutdown.
The court ruled the firings illegal.
The article discusses the impact of the chaos on the CDC.
